intro: Psychotria camporum, commonly known as the Camporom psychotria, is a species of flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in shaded, humid environments such as forest understories. Psychotria camporum is also noted for its potential ethnobotanical uses, though further research is needed to fully understand its properties.
